DataElement.preferredName: Prior Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Sex Cord-Stromal Tumor Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to anticancer drugs administered earlier in time for a neoplasm arising in the ovary or testis. It is composed of granulosa cells, Leydig cells, Sertoli cells, and fibroblasts. Each of these cell types may constitute the only cellular component that is present in the neoplasm or it may be mixed with other cell types in various combinations.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Sex Cord-Stromal Tumor Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to having given anticancer drugs earlier in time for a neoplasm arising in the ovary or testis (composed of granulosa cells, Leydig cells, Sertoli cells, and fibroblasts; each of these cell types may constitute the only cellular component that is present in the neoplasm or it may be mixed with other cell types in various combinations).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Anticancer drugs that kill cells, especially cancer cells.

Concepts.definition: A drug therapy that is used to destroy cancer cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: A neoplasm arising in the ovary or testis. It is composed of granulosa cells, Leydig cells, Sertoli cells, and fibroblasts. Each of these cell types may constitute the only cellular component that is present in the neoplasm or it may be mixed with other cell types in various combinations. The prognosis can not always be predicted on histologic grounds alone. Approximately, 10% of these tumors may metastasize. Representative examples include granulosa cell tumor, Leydig cell tumor, Sertoli cell tumor, and tumors of the thecoma-fibroma group.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm arising in the ovary or testis. It is composed of granulosa cells, Leydig cells, Sertoli cells, and fibroblasts. Each of these cell types may constitute the only cellular component that is present in the neoplasm or it may be mixed with other cell types in various combinations. The prognosis can not always be predicted on histologic grounds alone. Approximately, 10% of these tumors may metastasize. Representative examples include granulosa cell tumor, Leydig cell tumor, Sertoli cell tumor, and tumors of the thecoma-fibroma group.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient received prio
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received prior cytotoxic chemotherapy or biologics for sex cord stromal tumors (SCSTs)?
